Chapter:
Jennings-Zassenhaus-Lazard Quotients of L-presented groups
The nilpotent quotient algorithm for finitely L-presented groups and the p-quotient algorithm for finitely L-presented group generalize to an algorithm for computing a polycyclic presentation for the quotients of an L-presented group by the elements of the Jennings-Zassenhaus-Lazard series given recursively by \kappa_1g = g and \kappa_{n+1}g = [\kappa_{n}g,g] (\kappa_{\ceil{\frac{n+1}{p}}}G)^p.
returns a polycyclic presentation for the p-Jennings class-c quotient g/\kappa_{c+1}(g) of the L-presented group g if c is specified. If c is not given, this method attempts to compute the largest p-quotient of g and will terminate only if g has such a largest p-quotient.
The following example computes the 2-Jennings class-5 quotient of the Grigorchuk group.
gap> G:=ExamplesOfLPresentations(1);; gap> H:=JenningsQuotient(G,2,5); Pcp-group with orders [ 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2 ] gap> jcs:=JenningsSeries( H ); [ Pcp-group with orders [ 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2 ], Pcp-group with orders [ 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2 ], Pcp-group with orders [ 2, 2, 2, 2 ], Pcp-group with orders [ 2, 2, 2 ], Pcp-group with orders [ 2 ], Pcp-group with orders [ ] ] gap> List( [1..Length(jcs)-1], x->AbelianInvariants( jcs[x]/jcs[x+1] ) ); [ [ 2, 2, 2 ], [ 2, 2 ], [ 2 ], [ 2, 2 ], [ 2 ] ]
This method returns an epimorphism from the L-presented group g onto a p-Jennings quotient. If the optional argument c is given, the epimorphism is onto the maximal class-c quotient g//\kappa_{c+1}(g). If no second argument is given, this method attempts to compute an epimorphism onto the largest p-quotient of g. If g does not have a largest p-quotient, this method will not terminate.
The following example computes an epimorphism from the Grigorchuk group onto its 2-class-5 quotients.
gap> G := ExamplesOfLPresentations(1); <invariant LpGroup of size infinity on the generators [ a, b, c, d ]> gap> epi := EpimorphismJenningsQuotient( G, 2, 6 ); [ a, b, c, d ] -> [ g1, g2*g3, g2, g3 ] gap> Range( epi ); Pcp-group with orders [ 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2 ] gap> Length( JenningsSeries( Range( epi ) ) ); 7
